data.title: Dive into anything
data.text:
Just saw the council posting that they were going to build a nice new tarmac cycle and walkway between a bunch of towns linking to our city. "Ahh good!" I thought because the road is awful and there's no way to walk safely between them all and this should also encourage more people to cycle.

Facebook comments:

"Urgh is this a priority!?"

"Fix the potholes first!!!!"

"There are people needing homes!"

"My kid has autism and needs care but here the council is waisting [sic] money on this!"

Do people not understand budgets? Do people not understand that multiple things can be done at the same time? Do people not understand in general.

Same responses with literally anything. They could announce "we're giving everyone £2000 this year!" and people would be saying "BUT MY DEBT IS £3000!". Cretins.
